title: Pathetic Experience!

Staff not behaved properly!
Anything asked to provide to person sitting at reception, his reply always came “you should have told us” , even for simple dental kits and slippers!!

Why you have kept bed also….that should have also been provided when asked by guests!!!

Free breakfast which was offered was plain parantha, curd (bad quality), pohe (bad taste) and achaar

Come’on man…there is basic etiquette of replying to guests which is badly lacking  at your place!!!!

title: Conveniently located
text:
Very conveniently located specially if you are with children and have a car. They have valet parking(paid) , drop your car at the designated place near the public lift/parking , walk 50 mtrs for their lift which will take you up the hotel. 
Hotel lifts also take you up to the Mall Road which makes it very easy to enjoy Mall Road and you can make multiple trips if you like.
Didn’t like the breakfast spread though. While the staff was quite supportive, options were limited for a hotel of such status and which boasts of classy brewhouse and restaurant/cafe.
Rooms are decent though the property is old. We stayed in Combermere luxury which was quite spacious.
Extra bed is just a mattress on the floor so keep your expectations right.( we were a bit disappointed).

Will visit them again.

title: Excellent location, but efficiency of staff was a big drawback.
text:
there are various aspects to review in this hotel. 
firstly, upon entering the property no parking facility was present. travellers who usually move around Himachal Pradesh, travel by cars and not having a parking facility is a huge problem. 
check-in was very casual. no documents or identification proofs were asked upon checking up which can be a huge safety concern. 
while transporting our luggage from the reception to the rooms, the journey is via a huge long ramp, and the luggage wheels get damaged in the process. also the staff were banging the suitcases left right and centre and no care was given to the luggages. 
there are 3 lifts inside the property and it is quite complicated for guests to move around the property. 
the rooms were good enough for 2 persons and the washroom was a little old fashioned with no jet-spray next to the washroom area. 
towels were dirty and yellow in colour. 
location of the property is excellent since you can reach Mall Road from inside the property. 
the hotel had 3 cafes and extensive menu. shisha is also available in the hotel cafe. 
breakfast had limited options, but quality and taste of the food was good. 
staff was friendly but not very efficient 
in room dining facility was good and we got all we needed.
placeInfo/address: The Mall, Shimla 171001 India

title: Poor  customer service and cleanliness.
text:

title: Exceptional Hospitality with a Heartwarming Local Touch
text:
My stay at Radisson Jass Shimla, though just for one night, was an experience I’ll always cherish. From the moment I arrived, I was met with genuine warmth and kindness. The entire staff, especially at the front desk, were extremely courteous and down-to-earth. It was heartening to know that most of them are local Pahadis—people native to Shimla—who bring a special charm and humility to their service.

After two sleepless nights traveling from Bangalore, carrying my 8-year-old due to limited connectivity, I was exhausted. Mr. Rakesh at the front desk went out of his way to arrange an early check-in, ensuring my daughter and I could rest. That thoughtful gesture made all the difference and showed true hospitality.

The breakfast spread was generous, and the in-room dining service was both fast and delicious. The hotel also provides a free shuttle to nearby attractions, which added great convenience to our short stay.

Everything about the experience—from the service to the people—was simply perfect. Radisson Jass Shimla is a shining example of hospitality done right. I truly hope they continue this level of service. People will not only love the hotel but also the warm-hearted Pahadi spirit behind it.

title: Unsafe, Worst and Unprofessional experience
text:
We were 5 girls who booked 2 rooms here. In the evening, the neighboring room had extremely loud guests (including some foreigners). Despite complaining again and again, the reception falsely claimed the room was unoccupied and there might be staff in the room.
Later at night, one intoxicated guest from the neighbouring room started banging on our door and shouting. We were terrified and had to call security as he might have had weapons. The man started returning to his room on seeing the security guard. The man had alcohol crates and might be drugs too in his room and was shifted somewhere else late at night.
Shockingly, the next morning the manager, Rahul Rana, instead of apologizing, accused us of causing trouble to that guest and refused to show CCTV footage or refunding the amount for stay. We were not able to sleep whole night. 
This was the worst hotel experience ever — no safety, no professionalism. Not recommended, especially for women travellers.
ownerResponse/text:
Dear Guest,

Thank you for sharing your concerns regarding your recent stay. I sincerely apologize for the inconvenience and distress caused during your visit.

I personally met with you on the night of the incident to address the matter and immediately arranged for a security guard to be stationed on your floor to ensure your safety and comfort.

Earlier that evening, our team had offered you a room change, which was declined at the time. Following the situation, I also spoke with the guest from the neighboring room—a senior citizen—who explained that he had knocked on your door at approximately 23:10 hours to request a reduction in volume from your room, as he was unable to sleep. Nonetheless, considering the circumstances, we relocated him to another room later that night to prevent further disturbance.

We thoroughly reviewed the CCTV footage and found no evidence of any physical threat or aggressive behavior. As a gesture of goodwill and to acknowledge the disruption, we waived the additional charge for a third person staying in your room.

 Our team made every effort to manage the situation promptly and professionally. We take guest safety and satisfaction very seriously and are committed to continually improving our processes to prevent such occurrences in the future.

Best Regards

title: Disappointing Service at Radisson Jazz Shimla
text:
I just moved to Radisson Jazz Shimla after a great stay at Radisson Kufri, and honestly, it’s been disappointing.

Check-in was slow, though Aditya at the front desk was helpful. I asked about an paid upgrade and saw the junior suite, still deciding on it. But my real issue is with the service.

First, I ordered boneless biryani, but they sent one with bones. They replaced it, but why mess up a simple order? Then, my thukpa arrived with spillage and a hair. Didn’t take a pic of that (because, ew), but I did catch one on the salt shaker. Basic hygiene should not be an issue at a Radisson.

Housekeeping was another letdown. I called 3 times to get my plates cleared after dinner—nothing. They finally picked them up the next morning, so my room smelled like food all night.

Also, I couldn’t help but notice that foreign guests seem to get extra attention. I get the whole international hospitality thing, but Indian guests are paying the same and deserve the same service. If the hotel is understaffed, they need to manage it better.

The bathroom also needs work—tiles look like they need scrubbing, and parts of the wall are peeling. Didn’t expect this from a Radisson property.

I still have two more nights here and hope things improve. Planning to check out the spa too—fingers crossed that goes well. Sharing this so the hotel (hopefully) takes note and improves for future guests.

Having previously stayed at the stunning Oberoi Cecil in Shimla, my expectations for the Radisson were quite high. Unfortunately, my experience was somewhat mixed.

Firstly, the location is a bit of a letdown. While the hotel is situated just behind the Mall Road, I have certainly stayed at more convenient spots. The uphill walk to reach the road can be quite challenging, especially after a long day of exploring. However, the hotel does provide a complimentary pick-up and drop service to the nearest point on the Mall Road, which is a nice touch.

On a positive note, the staff at the Radisson were incredibly friendly and welcoming. Tamanna at the reception was particularly helpful, and our check-in process was seamless. The hotel's layout can be a bit confusing due to its sloped design, but there are elevators available on multiple levels, which made getting around easier.

When it comes to dining, I must say I was pleasantly surprised. The food at the in-house restaurant and through room service was fabulous, with a great variety of dishes to choose from. Tanisha and Tejeshwar in the restaurant were attentive and made our dining experience even more enjoyable. A special mention goes to Niranjan, who helped organize a private bonfire dinner for my parents' 50th wedding anniversary, though this did come at an additional cost.

Overall, while I would recommend the Radisson Shimla for its excellent service and food, it may not be my first choice for accommodation in Shimla, especially when compared to the exceptional experience I had at the Oberoi Cecil.

title: Delightful experience, great hospitality!!
text:
Post a 2-year hiatus from travel, we zeroed in on Shimla on a whim, mainly driven by the local Summer Festival. We decided on Marina without much planning, key factor being easy access to the Mall where the fest was to be. Looking back, I can gladly say that choosing Marina was the best decision we made. Superior Room was spacious and the desk & Wi-fi provided us a comfortable space for urgent office work. Courtesy & pleasant behavior of the entire staff from front desk to kitchen & housekeeping was refreshing. Though busy, the staff always made sure of including the personal touch in all our interactions. Room-service & Housekeeping was efficient. Regarding food, be it the buffet breakfast or Room service, the food was fresh & tasty. Breakfast at the roof top was a pleasure and a big shout out to chefs in the Open kitchen & all the servers who served us with big smiles on their faces. Kudos to the DJ as well, who relentlessly played the best tunes (requests even) to jumpstart our days. Property itself is spacious and tastefully done with a well-equipped gym, playroom, and spa. The restaurant & bar are elegant and beautifully done. A big shout out to Mercy from the spa who took great care of us. As we had to check out quite early in the morning, the kitchen was kind enough to pack sandwiches & cupcakes for us. 
All in all, its a great place to be if you are in Shimla. My heartfelt thanks & best wishes to the Team at Marina, keep up the great work you are doing!!

title: Short notice booking - no regrets plus great location
text: Booked this hotel for 2 nights after 1 night in a hotel with no heating that was freezing.  Location was excellent just off the pedestrianised Mall, the rooms were warm (central heating), modern and spotlessly clean.  If you are visiting Shimla when the weather can be changeable plus cold having a warm room to come back to where you can dry off and prepare to go back out agin is a must.  Note that a lot of hotels do not offer central heating only electric fires which are not adequate when the temperature drops below freezing and there is snow on the ground.   Beware the Heritage tag which is applied to a lot of hotels.  Highly recommend the Marina for any stay in Shimla.  Note that the hotel seems to not be offered by European tour operators which is pity.

title: MARINA Is Really Good
text: 3 nights 3 rooms in Feb 2nd week on recommendation of one in the group who stayed here before and encouraged by positive reviews at TripAdvisor. had booked  valley facing  superior rooms but to our pleasant surprised were  upgraded to Executive Rooms. OUR IMPRESSIONS: Arrived in own cars after negotiating a short but quite  steep stretch of road , not unusual for a hill property. on arrival parking assistants immediately took charge of the cars ,unloaded and consigned the cars to basement parking (hotel has parking space adjacent to the property at road level also). RECEPTION/CHECK IN: Although at road level but actually 3rd floor of the hotel .Very polite and welcoming , check in smooth and fast. Lobby area quite large for a hotel of this size. LOCATION: Just perfect. Last private property on that part of the road. Starting point of Mall Road from hotel side. Ridge just 8-10 minutes leisurely walk on the Mall.This seems strongest part of Marina. ROOMS: Our executive rooms at the lobby level(3rd floor) were absolute delight. Very large with balcony. Over looking the beautiful valley and mountains beyond - great view.. Very comfortable bed. sofa executive desk. Room lighting very good. Electrical sockets conveniently spread all over. Understated ambiance . Clean, very well maintained. Bath rooms spic & span with shower enclosure. Good quality toilet essentials, bath towels.Super central AC/Heating . Rooms offer a very relaxing and peaceful stay. FOOD/BUFFET: Massive dining area at the zero level with a panoramic  view of the valley again a pleasant surprise. Buffet brekfast well laid out. However almost same veg fare everyday and non veg fare quite inadequate. Food and beverage quality good. The best part here is superlative service. Tea coffee or any eats ordered from the table served in a jiffy by very attentive and polite staff. Food served in the rooms also excellent. TRAVEL DESK: Although had own cars but preferred a hired one due snow laden tricky roads. Provided a brand new Crysta . Driver quite experienced and knowledgeable which made our trip to snow laden new Kufri and other areas very enjoyable.  Summary: Very pleasant experience overall. Facilities and amenities offered by Marina are first class-best in class in Shimla perhaps. Strongly recommended. Would appear to be a little over priced though but worth it frankly.

title: Excellent location for visiting Shimla with friends
text:
Approach to this hotel is along a steep small single track road by car.  The hotel has a car park which is located next to it however the road directly after that is prohibited so it is not possible to drive any further.  Initial impression of the hotel decor upon arrival was good, we were greeted with a cold drink, although check in was slow.  The rooms were spacious and beautifully decorated with nice views across the valley.  A little disappointed to find there was no iron in the room which was made available by request.  For a hotel of this quality there were no slippers in the rooms.  We were a group of friends who wanted a place to meet, have a drink and a chat in the evening before dinner and found the bar to be very dark and dated with a constant loop of music videos.  Service in the bar however was fine.
We went to the restaurant and were seated by 9 pm, no one came to take our order, eventually we managed to attract someone's attention.  After placing our order the food arrived after 10.20 pm.  The food was good but by then hunger had ruined the evening.  Needless to say that the service in the restaurant was abysmal with no visible sign of any management.  Breakfast the following morning was satisfactory.

title: Overall average. Location is best
text: First things first. It is probably the best located hotel in Shimla. They have their own lift which opens on the mall road. But the lift entrance from Cart Road is about 50 meters inside from the road, and entry is through the crowded public tourism lift passage. There is no point of alighting. So basically you have to get off from the vehicle on the road (Cart Road) itself, walk 50 mtrs / climb stairs through crowded municipal lift passage, and then reach the hotel lift. Parking is not available, although they help in parking at the municipal parking just opposite the hotel. This is a bit cumbersome and irritating. The rooms are neat and clean, service / housekeeping is good and responsive. "Luxury" rooms in new block are very small, with no balcony or view. Windows face the municipal lift and anyone can peep into your room from there. They have a good restaurant and bar, and another cafe (cafe Sol) and bar on top floor. Both are good. The restaurant is very small and expensive, although food is good. They do not reserve tables for their own guests, nor inform when table is available. In house guests also have to wait outside like everyone else, which is very irritating. Would request them to change this policy as I have not seen this anywhere that I have travelled. Even celebrated restaurants in hotels treat their own guests differently and take advance reservations for them. Tariff for lowest category of rooms (luxury) is about 7500/- ($100/-) per night (w/o bf) , which is quite steep for the quality of rooms and overall experience, which is at best average. Had it not been for the location, one could definitely give it a miss.

title: GREAT LOCATION, UNPROFESSIONAL STAFF!
text:
We booked Hotel Combermere after reading through the numerous reviews as we were going to shimla after 5 years to celebrate my birthday.
The only pros/advantage of this hotel is its private lift to the mall.
cons:
 We booked the junior suite room and expected it to be great but the view from the room was disappointing, there was no privacy at all and people walking through the bridge connecting the mall road and the public lift could simply peep into the room. We had to put on the curtains throughout our stay.

The in room dining menu was ridiculously expensive and we largely refrained from ordering food from the menu however, since our 3 year old son traveling along we had to order food at times.At one instance, we requested the room service to prepare suji kheer for the kid but the request was bluntly refused. I personally visited the restaurant and requested the manager, Mr. Chauhan for the kheer but he very rudely refused my request and said that staff is very busy and my request cant be entertained, I asked him if he can do it after an hour or so.. He again refused and told me that sooji was not available in the hotel and it cant be made.We then requested him to make dal without any tadka but they somehow missed the intruction and made the dal with tadka and chillies. We tried calling the room service to make fresh dal but no one picked up the call after repetetive attempts. My son did not eat a single. I called them again the next morning with my request for the kheer but it was again refused. We requested for Khichdi to which they obliged but charged 350 bucks for a bowl of khichdi.
Also, most of the staff members were not wearing the mask.We also faced issue with shower in the bathroom and had to call house keeping to fix the issue 
All in all the location of the hotel is great, bang on the mall road and room size is also decent but, attitude of the in room dining staff needs to be changed and they should should be a little empathic. You do not expect such experience after paying around 12.5k per night.We have never faced such behavior during our stays in the past.

title: THE BEST LOCATION IN THE TOWN
text:
A very nice property bang on the most sought after tourist place, The Mall, in Shimla, the Queen of Hills. The best thing about this property is Location, Location and Location. This property has got its own private lift to take you to this hotel and also to take you to the Mall, saving your time, money and effort to go through the Government Tourist Department lift to reach the Mall.
If you are driving, Valet parking is provided free but the parking is paid.
The rooms and bathrooms are spacious and comfortable providing you nice view of the valley in front, some rooms are provided with balconies also.
The staff is polite and courteous, providing service with smile. The House Keeping Service was very prompt. The Hotel Manager, Mr. Rana takes personal interest in making your stay comfortable. There were some minor issues with our room which were promptly taken care of by Mr. Rana.
The complimentary breakfast was fairly good and tasty. The F & B Manager, Mr. Chouhan and his staff was taking good care of all our requirements. They have very nice restaurant called ‘Café Sol’ on 8th floor with opening to the Mall. This restaurant offers very nice, tasty and well presented Continental cuisine (other cuisine also served). The food is prepared in a modern, very neat and clean open kitchen.
Popular tourist attractions, such as, Town Hall, Gaiety Theater, Scandal Point, The Ridge, Church etc are within walking distance of this property. Similarly the best shopping experience in Shimla is available on  The Mall itself.
I would like to highly recommend this property for stay during your visit to Shimla.

Dear Guest,

Glad to know that your stay with us was comfortable and you enjoyed our food and services.

title: Great property minus hospitality
text:
I stayed with family for 3 days in the Executive room.

The hotel property and infrastructure are amazing. It is walking distance from the Mall Road with ample parking space. The rooms are spacious and luxurious. The view is just fair – it overlooks the town. The food – it is one of the best in town. For all three days, we ordered atleast one meal at the hotel and it was great all the time. Their chef and F&B team are amazing.

Inspite of all the good things, the service standards leave you gasping for more. The frontdesk is unwelcoming. I observed the same when they interacted with other guests as well. They do not entertain any requests. For example, there was a reluctance in giving 1 extra quilt; there was a reluctance in pushing the check-out time by 15 minutes; there was a reluctance in serving one extra glass of refreshment; there was reluctance in modifying our package from EP to CP (we were willing to pay for it); etc. However, the housekeeping and porter/security staff were very helpful.

A stay at Marina is definitely expensive. I did not get my money’s worth

My suggestion to Marina’s owners – you have invested in a great asset (infrastructure). Please do invest in people and hospitality to make this hotel better.

title: Very good
text: Visited this place for lunch. Ordered a Non-veg platter, Sicilian Punch, Paneer Lababdar and Tandoori roti. I ve dined at almost all restaurants in and around Shimla including Oberoi Cecil, Wildflower and Radisson. Not once have i been satisfied with the quality of food. Poor quality non veg, rotten fish at times, over cooked and dry tikkas, or sometimes even sour paneer; not to mention the exorbitant prices...  i cd sum up my eating out experience at Shimla like this. Marina however was a pleasant experience. I went to this place on some friend's suggestion. I am glad i did. The non veg platter was excellent. Chicken and mutton and fish was melting in the mouth. Best part was that the non veg was absolutely fresh. For Rs.800, it was not bad at all. I wont say it was not over priced because Shimla on the whole is overpriced. The scicilian punch at about Rs.530... was definitely super priced and was average. The Paneer lababdar and rotis were amazing. Serving was good. The staff was courteous and sensitive to our requirements. Over all a very pleasant lunch. Will definitely visit this place and try out all their stuff.

title: Disappointing
text:
We stayed at this hotel for 4 nights and while it is comfortable and clean, overall we found it a bit of a disappointment. 

1. When we arrived we were shown to a beautiful suite, but it didn’t have the hot tub described and given the amazing location, our view was of the carpark! When we complained we were shown to a smaller room with a great hillside view and given the choice of the 2, so we chose the 2nd one. But we had booked a suite, so lost out on the deal. 
*Be aware that the photos they show of the suites have the curtains closed, clearly to hide the fact you don’t get a hillside view.*
2. The next issue was the hairdryer, the only plug point near a mirror was faulty so the plug wouldn’t stay in the socket. We informed reception who kept sending new hairdryers, each time we explained what the issue was by showing them, but despite being told maintenance would come, it wasn’t fixed during our stay meaning the hairdryer was unusable.
3. The air conditioning in our room was really inconsistent and fairly ineffective, meaning you woke up hot and uncomfortable in the night.
4. We booked some treatments at the spa, we returned to the hotel especially to have these treatments, but on arrival were told they couldn’t go ahead due to the noise from building work. We said we didn’t mind the noise, the staff then admitted it was their Diwali celebration so they couldn’t not do the treatments for us. So basically they had lied. Plus no one had contacted us to advise the appointments had been cancelled meaning some of our limited time in Shimla was wasted. 
5. Reception staff were all very pleasant and friendly, but whatever you asked them, they asked you to take a seat while they looked into your query. It felt like no one could make a decision or answer a question without checking with a superior first.
We just didn’t feel this hotel lived up to the Radisson brand or the cost charged for the rooms, so can’t recommend it as a choice for staying in Shimla.

title: Well Located Hotel Offering Excellent Service In Every Respect
text:
We were fortunate enough to be upgraded to a Business Suite, partly because I am a long term member of the Radisson Rewards scheme. 

The hotel offers excellent views over part of Shimla and is only a short (1km?) walk from The Ridge. For those who do not fancy walking on Indian roads, however, a shuttle service is provided to the base of a staircase leading to Christ Church. 

Breakfast covers a very wide range of foods, including Indian and western offerings, and the cappuccinos are the equal of any I’ve had on numerous visits to Italy. The a la carte dinner menu is extensive and portions were very large (and extremely tasty) while a buffet is also offered whenever there are tour groups staying at the hotel.

All staff throughout the hotel were well-mannered, pleasant and helpful when needed and taxis/transfers were provided in an efficient manner using well maintained cars and safe, sensible drivers.

It's an easy walk to Ridge from the hotel. I booked 2 rooms from 7th to 10th jan 2019 for my family having 5 yr and 12 yrs old daughters and 70 yr old mother. All age groups enjoyed yo the fullest. Your car can reach uptil lift from where their drivers park the vehicle in the public parking which is paid @Rs 180/ day.
Rooms are okay, higher floors like 502,503,402, 403 offer better view as compared to other rooms. When we reached there these rooms were not available but the manager allowed us to change the rooms very next day to 502,503.This was a good gesture on hotel part.
Staff is very helpful and smiling all the time.
Breakfast spread was OK but  can be better and can include more choices. Too much of the repetition in it. Central heating was very good especially when outside temp was -3 and -4℃. 24 hrs hot and cold water was available. No water problem at all which I heard was an imp issue in several other hotels in shimla. 
Beware of step while entering in washrooms. 
Cafe SOL was good for serving international cuisines. 
Checkin and checkout was hastle free.
Bakery products are famous in shimla and good bakeries are available within 100m on either side on mall road.
If want to eat outside then Nalini restaurant is right adjoining along with Shere-Punjab which serve all indian choices. 
All in all this property is a good choice for vacation if you get a
Reasonable deal.

title: Ideal hotel to stay in Shimla
text:
We stayed in a Luxury room for a couple of days. 
Room: Spacious, well furnished with fridge and facilities for tea and coffee. Towel and toiletries. 2 criticisms: a) The view was not good as it looked out onto a construction site beside the tourism lift. b) We would have preferred a cot for the third person but was provided with a mattress on the floor instead, which was slightly disappointing. 
However, fantastic views from the common balconies, the bar and the open air restaurant.
Service: Courteous and prompt.
Food: Fantastic choices both at the restaurant and the cafe at the top. Generous portions. Reasonable prices. Great breakfast spread including bacon and sausages.
Location: The entry to the reception is from Cart road and the other access is from the Mall. So, great location. However, the initial steep climb up the stairs from Cart road can be slightly challenging for the elderly.
Overall: Ideally located hotel with great food and prompt service. Ideal for families. Despite the minor issues mentioned above, highly recommended.

title: Dated property, good location
text:
We stayed for a couple of nights in March 2018. First of all getting into Shimla itself took several hours for the last few kilometres - there is a serious congestion problem with this place - someone should sort it out. When you finally get to the hotel the tax can only drop you off on a very busy road. You then have to call reception and hope someone can help you with your bags. 
The hotel is located in a building site where they are building a new  lift and more parking. After waiting ages for someone to help us with the luggage I ended up lugging it through the building site, up lots of stairs and finally to the hotels private lift. Eventually you get to a pokey little reception area and when you finally check in you are led through some gloomy passages, up another lift to your room. The rooms are barely adequate, reminding me of Indian hotels from 30 years ago. Similarly the restaurant is dark and dingy not helped by dark wood paneling every where. 
Once you are settled in and find your way to the Mall (the main Shimla shopping street) things start to get a bit better and you find the location is ideal. The views from the hotel and the lifts are excellent, especially in the evening. The Mall and surrounding areas are a delight - loved the walk to the Vice regal lodge along the heritage walk. Also enjoyed the trek to Jakoo Mandir - the monkeys were great - they definitely have a game plan to extract goodies from the visitors. You'll probably find better hotels in Shimla but this is probably in the best location.
(And by the way the WIFI is useless).

After some discussion at the reception they gave us upgraded rooms but these rooms were not clean at all, the bathrooms were smelling and the linen was also not very clean.
 Nothing in the hotel is complimentary i mean they don,t even provide an iron and want you to send your clothes to the laundry for pressing which is very expensive.
As far as food is concerned we had breakfast at the hotel and all i can say is that  the food quality was below average. Even for a regular thing like an omelette was not prepared well and was almost swimming in oil.
We paid 7500 per room and i don't think this place is worth even that much.
The only good thing about this hotel is that its on the Mall and has private lift access . Apart from this there is nothing positive i can say about this place so if possible avoid staying here.

title: Heritage My Backside
text:
Calling this a heritage hotel is like slapping a label on a tin of baked beans and calling it caviar. 
We were given room 104 and it was bloody awful. Period furniture??
I don't think you can call a grotty wardrobe that your Auntie Vera or but chucked out in 1967 'period'.
The Windows didn't fit properly and i was freezing all night (arriving from Delhi probably made it worse). There was an electric bar heater that didn't heat the room as it was all going out of the gaps between the window and frame. 
The hotel was noisy with inconsiderate people talking loudly until late and then at 6.45am I was woken by the sound of hawking, coughing and spitting. 
There did seem to be other rooms that were nicer than ours and the breakfast smelt nice although we hurried out of there so quickly we didn't stop to eat or stay the second night we'd paid for. 
I have to say that in a month of travelling round India this was the worst accommodation of them all.

The hotel is very well located on the Mall Road. Shimla. Whereas food and other amenities are concerned, the same are good and one enjoys the stay because of the fact that the hotel is on the main Mall Road; the moment we step out, the Mall starts. The rooms are good and the service is also nice.  

Though, the travellers who reach Shimla by their own cars find it difficult to park their cars and arrange for transportation of their luggage two floors above to the hotel reception. There is no separate parking. The cars are to be parked down at the main road parking (near the Lift) which is again under major repair and the construction work is going on. Overall,l a very good hotel if there are no parking issues and the visitor is travelling by public transport. 

Dr. Rajesh Bhola
Spiritual Writer & Columnist

text:
We visited this so called 4 star hotel on 4 th march 2017 . Everything was going smooth right from the baggage staff till the room service staff . This was our 3 rd visit to the hotel in last 3 years but few  incidents  changed our entire opinion . As we were chilling in the room and so at first we ordered some salads and snacks . After this when we ordered food the room service operator said " sir aapne jo order karna hai ek baar order kardo baar baar mat ring karo " . Can u believe it ? I still cannot . Is this called hospitality ? 

We were 3 couples with 2 small kids checking out on 5 th march and we we were heading to kufri and while checking out we requested the staff on the reception to heat the kids milk lying in the refrigerator of our room ( kids cannot be given any kind of milk so we were carrying tetra packs of the milk for kids which were kept in the refrigerator  ) as the kids needed it while travelling to kufri . At first the staff at the reception said " not to worry " . While we were checking out the front desk staff Mr ANIL KUMAR casually replied " sorry we cannot heat the milk " . At first glace i thought i was hearing a joke but the man was serious . His name is Anil Kumar and is the  most arrogant man i ve come across . After this our wives had to be controlled as no mother can tolerate such an attitude . Any heartless man would have done it but such an answer reveals the mind of management . Inspite of my asking the number of general manager or the owner i was just given  an email and i also know that mail will never reach the higher management . Anyways i m sure my review on this site will reach the higher management and i hope they take swift action to teach there management the spelling of Hospitality . 

Regards
Mohit ghai
Ludhiana

title: Regular Upper Middle Class Hotel
text:
Clean ,efficient ,dependable ,a favorite for a lot of people on a comfortable fixed  budget .Excellent location from the point of view of accessibility, next to the lift parking available, when not being "beautified"  as the local contractor puts it . No scenic view at all as long as you don't consider the drain next to the lift as scenery. The exception being the rooms at the extreme end of the hotel.
Located  on the mall .Excellent cafe at the mall level ,great variety,comfortable prices.
The restaurant in the hotel serves good Indian and indianised international and Indochinese cuisine .
Vegetarian breakfast apart from eggs.
But that is to be expected .
Service normally efficient,expect in the night ,when a request is responded to next morning .The staff converse with great gusto at all decibels in the corridors. 
Rooms have good temperature control ,house keeping is efficient.
No tissue boxes ,limited toilet paper,cramped Loo's ,mediocre toiletries (carry your own ).
Don't expect top of the line service or standards .
Simply put If used to first or business class ,this is like flying economy albeit with an efficient air line .
Control your expectations and enjoy what you have .

title: Mixed Experiences at Hotel Alpine Heritage Residency
text:
I travelled to Shimla in the month of September 2014 with my family and booked accommodation at Hotel Alpine Heritage Residency. The location of the hotel is good as it is outside from the hustle and bustle of congested Shimla but The Mall is easily accessible from the hotel. And cab can go till the entry gate of the hotel. We chose a Family Suite and the room we were given (room# 501) was located just beside the reception. View of the green valley and hills from the room was good. We stayed there for 3 nights and found the accommodation better than average (if not very good/really satisfied). We got the chance of having a glance at a few other double bedded rooms (most probably The Royal Retreat, The Imperial Bedchamber, The Super Deluxe and Deluxe Bedchambers), while roaming inside the hotel and felt that those double bedded rooms are far better than the family suite given to us in terms of space and quality. The quality of bed was a bit disappointing. Door locks and the condition of the doors, curtain rods, windows were a bit damaged and not properly maintained. Rooms were clean though on the very first day we found a few insects/worms in the room (might be due to non-cleaning of the room for a prolonged period) and we had to call the hotel staffs quite a few times to clean the same. Regarding quality of foods served at the hotel, it was good (though not excellent). Hotel staffs were good and we found them well-mannered and polite. Manager Mr. Rana and Marketing Director Mr. Puneet Chopra - we found both of them very courteous and gentle! They addressed each and every concern of us promptly. Overall, a nice and pleasant stay at Alpine Heritage Residency!

Pros: Location of the hotel, Polite and gentle hotel staffs, clean rooms, quality of service and food is good/satisfactory.
Cons: Need more maintenance (especially for the Family Suite).

Can be recommended for staying at this hotel if a calm and quite stay is preferable

title: Good view from room - needs renovation and better service
text:
We booked this hotel through our travel agent in Mumbai. It is a small hotel facing the Circular Road opposite Talland. One can access Circular Road only on foot as vehicular access is from Cart Road below. The view from the room was very good. The room that we stayed was small and cozy with a small but nice balcony. But the hotel is in urgent need of renovation. The walls were not clean. Some tiles in the toilet were missing. The carpet in the lobby / dining area has seen better days. Overall structure of the hotel appears good. If one looks closely, then one would realize that the whole place needs a face-lift.    
We would have overlooked these deficiencies but service was found wanting. We booked a taxi through the hotel to drop us at the bus stand for our onward trip to Manali. However, the taxi arrived late by 20 minutes and we almost missed our bus. The person at the hotel counter did not seem to bother and kept on blaming the taxi operator. Also, we had ordered for breakfast and that too did not arrive in time.

title: Not A Bad Experience
text:
I and my wife were here in July this year. I'd booked a room earlier and they hotel sent a cab to pick us up from the railway station(chargeable of course). The hotel is a converted bunglow, a quaint property and not in the middle of noise and pollution (Thank God). The rooms were nice for the price. Our friends in the next room had a totally different furniture type than ours. I later learnt that each bedroom was done differently. The hotel is average but the team there is very nice. The hotel was in need of some refurbishment and when we talked to the owner (who happened to be there), he told us that renovation was to begin after the peak season was over. Although it was a nice hotel with nice staff, somehow it lacked the magic to make me want to come back again and again. 
By the way, they have suites also. So, if you are travelling as a group or as a family, you could look at that option. The management was also gracious enough to give us a 20% discount on the room tariff.

title: Satisfying stay at the "Alpine Heritage" - with Colonial type ambience
text:
For one of our biking excursions, I & my friend decided to visit Shimla. It was late evening till we manage to leave from Chandigarh (though we had pledged to leave maximum till 4:00p.m.). Thats why, we had to take an overnight halt mid-way & we reached Shimla the next morning. As soon as we reached, we started the search for a hotel. However looking at the population & tourist burst at Shimla nowadays, we absolutely did not want to take-up a hotel in the middle of the town.

We were looking for a peaceful hotel away from the bustling city traffic & noise but not too far to come back walking as well. Thats when after more than an hour of search & checking out a number of hotels, we came accross "Alpine". It was an instant hit for us. The hotel had a nice ambience with a British-colonial touch. Also this property was a perfect match according to our needs. I was surprised to see the cleanliness well maintained even in off-seasons! You could barely locate a speck of dust anywhere not only in the room, but also in the lobby, reception, etc. Above all the service was prompt & pretty good with tariff rates optimum. They even co-ordinated with us in arranging for a heater in September as it was drizzling & we were not prepared for such weather!

Overall I would say, the stay at "Alpine" was pretty satisfying & enjoying. Belonging to the Cust Srvc industry, I sometimes am very fussy about the service, but here I would say it was absolutely value for money!!!
